comment: Very apparent that Professor Shealy loves teaching and loves history! Very knowledgable! The only critique that I have is that the class was solely based off of four tests that were difficult at times. All lockdown AND webcam. If you are not a good test taker, DO NOT take this class. Show up to class or he WILL drop your grade!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Only grades are 4 tests. No cumulative final. Attendance mandatory. Imo show up to every class and force yourself to pay attention instead of taking notes. Then when test comes around study power points and don't read textbook if you are stretched for time. Tests online. Lockdown.

I took the honors version of this class. Professor Shealy really knows his stuff! His lectures are not very interesting at times as someone who doesn't like history, but he makes it easy and I did not mind going to class. There's only 2 tests, but we wrote 4 easy papers on books and that balanced it out. No textbook, just books that he chooses.

Has mid term and final that are each 1/3 of grade and 2 quizzes that are each 1/6. does not offer bonus and reads straight off the power points. lectures are boring but he really cares for his students. I'm not good at history and i barely got a B in the class
Really easy class. Midterm and final are a little more difficult than the first and second test, but really great man. Very intelligent and passionate about his work

I was never liked history, nor was I good at history. Dr. Shealy made this class pretty enjoyable and fairly simple. There is no memorization of dates and he really emphasizes what needs to be studied for the quizzes and tests. He does mention the study abroad trip to Italy quite a bit, but thats because he is passionate about it.

Personally, I've never been too found of this period in history. Despite Shealy's good-nature, his test questions seem to all come from things you wouldn't think to study. This may be a caveat of my personal capabilities - I've never been too found of memorizing things. If you're okay with reading a ton to get by, this class is for you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: Professor Shealy is an awesome teacher who cares about his students. He often goes off on tangents about the Italy study abroad program that he heads, but he is a great teacher.

Professor Shealy is an amazing lecturer. All material you need to know are on powerpoints, but definitely show up to class because he will explain it more in detail. There are only 4 grades for the entire semester. He is one of the most caring professors I have ever had, and truly cares about his student's success. Willing to work with you to help.

The class I took was pure discussion and it was great! The reading is easy and entertaining, which makes the discussions good. Shealy is encouraging and makes you feel comfortable discussing with the class

Pretty good teacher. 3 tests (including the final) that are half multiple choice and half essay. if you pay attention and take notes in class and the online lectures, lets should be easy. textbook wasnt needed (personally) but if you dont go to class youll need it for notes. Very nice person, and his lectures weren't boring. hybrid course available

Pretty easy class! I am not the biggest fan of history but his class is pretty easy and interesting. I took him as a hybrid class and I would definitely recommend that to anyone. He does straightforward power points and the tests come directly from those notes. Every test has an essay but those aren't difficult either. If you can, TAKE HIM!!

Really easy World History class. Lectures are interesting and straightforward, and Shealy is pretty entertaining. I took this class for a hybrid, and he puts the powerpoints online for the online portion of the class. Tests are on D2L, and have a multiple choice portion and an essay portion. The final is just the last test in the class.

Shealy is a retired teacher who comes back to teach 1-2 classes a semester. Tests that are 30 MC and a short essay at the end. He tells you the subjects that you can choose from for the essays, so you can think ofwrite it the night before and memorize. He is talks A LOT about Montepulciano, Italy! We are pretty sure he had 3 mini strokes in class

Emmitt is a very nice guy. He is enthusiastic about history and you can tell by his teaching. He is very knowledgeable and will answer all of your questions, pretty easy to get him onto a tangent about specifics because he enjoys talking about it so much. Tests are straight forward and basically right from you notes. Shorts essay at the end of each

I love this guy! I took the 8 week class with 3 hour classes. Which, yes, was long and sometimes I wanted to fall asleep.. But I normally really do not like history AT ALL and he just put things in a way that is interesting and relates past history to current things to make it more understandable. 3 tests that are worth more, about 5 quizzes

Professor Shealy's class was a joy to take. He is very well educated but is not snobby. Very down to earth and always has a fun story or anecdote to go along with what we are learning. He will push the study abroad and he is the one who convinced me to pull the trigger on it. Hope to take again!

Really, really sweet professor. He's passionate about what he teaches and loves sharing his knowledge. The texts he assigned were interesting and all we did in class was discuss them. After each text, we wrote an opinionated paper about what we thought and how we liked it. Very easy class.

You are allowed to miss up to 2 days before he counts off on your grade. Overall, was an easy class and class was actually enjoyable. All the tests come from the power points. There are 3 multiple choice tests and 3 multiple choice with essays and that is all that makes up your grade. He is a nice professor and very approachable. Take him!!!

Dr. Shealy is very helpful and nice. His test are easy and straight from the powerpoint slides. Do not bother buying the textbook, you will not need it. I definitely recommend him, especially for those who are not very interested in history like me. He makes it so clear and easy. TAKE HIM!!

He is the best professor that I have had at KSU. He is willing to help whenever you need it, and he really cares about his students. His class is mandatory to attend, but that didn't matter to me because he made it enjoyable to attend. I HIGHLY recommend him. He is very passionate about history, and strives to see his students succeed.

His class was boring. Endless powerpoints posted on D2L, but attendance is mandatory. 3 scantron exams with essay, each 25% of grade. Remaining 25% is split between 3 scantron exams without essay. These are called exams, but are weighted as quizzes. 1. Browse reddit during class 2. Before the exam make a flashcard for every bulletpoint. 3. Get an A

I highly recommend taking Dr. Shealy's class. He is a wonderful professor, and he is very helpful with any questions you have. He responds to emails quickly and really wants his students to succeed. I had him in the Great Books Program this semester, and we didn't take any tests; we only wrote papers and had a final project. He was an easy grader.

Dr. Shealy really knows his stuff and is the nicest man you will ever meet! He really likes to talk about history, so in my Great Books discussion class, he had to stop himself from lecturing. Learned quite a bit about European Medieval/Renaissance history and had a great time doing it! Would love to take another class of his.

Loved Dr. Shealy's class! He's so nice and extremely helpful with any questions or concerns you may have. Don't buy the book, I never even opened it. You have to attend class to do well on test & quizzes. Definitely take him if you have the chance!!

Dr Shealy is a first-class professor. Compelling lecturer, great course content (England to 1688), and his demeanor with students is outstanding. Cleary the way a professor should perform. Looking forward to taking more of his classes.

I thought England to 1688 was a very interesting class. Dr. Shealy was very patient in teaching the material. He covered the subject matter well, and always allowed room for students to ask questions or make comments. He was fairly nice person and very patient. There were 2 Exams and 1 research paper in the class. He is a very good/seasoned teacher

Dr Shealy is a rarity.  Very, very intelligent, and very, very nice.  He is one of the most patient professors I've had, and he will help you with anything you need.  Always answers emails promptly, too. I will take as many classes as I can from him!
really awesome guy, actually wants you to do good in the class, lots of powerpoints in class, easy 25 multiple choice quizzes and essay on tests. TAKE HIM

If you show up, pay attention and take ok notes,doesnt have to be great notes, you will do well. I printed out the powerpoints and made side notes on those and had no trouble. If in trouble he will do everything possible to help. Nothing but good things to say about him. He is not a breeze, you do need to be there, but he is very fair.

Four quizzes easy multiple choice, midterm and final easy mult choice and in class essay. Essays are easy if you know your stuff. Makes boring topics interesting and is a great professor. Attendence is mandatory. Take him! He is awesome.
Great teacher, very interesting and extremely helpful. If you don't know just ask and he will surely assist you.

Dr. Shealy is a really nice guy. He gives you all of the info he expects you to know. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he only tests from lecture & he does NOT post them online. He only has 4 grades the whole semester (midterm, final, and two quizzes). You've definitely got to study to get an A. I ended with a B.

He is an extremely nice guy, and he tries to make this class interesting, but for those of us who hate history, he does not make it easy:/ There are essays on the mid term and final, and history is not an easy subject to write an essay on.

Awesome professor! I'm not really into history that much, but he made class interesting. Provided great power points and explains everything clearly. He was always willing to answer questions and help out in any way possible. 2 quizzes, midterm, and a final. Attendance not mandatory, but go to class to get a good grade! TAKE HIM IF POSSIBLE!
A very nice professor who teaches a great class.  Patient with questions and repeated himself without any rancor when requested.  Exams are fairly written and graded.  Recommend.
Dr. Shealy is the best!  If you have an opportunity to take a class from him, do it!

I have taken him for Greek/Roman Hist and Renaissance and Reformation.  AWESOME prof.  Funny, interesting, and so nice!  Remembers his students from previous classes.  Tests easier than other upper level hist classes I've taken.  Lectures slowly and clearly and is open to questions and comments.  Highly recommend.

Very interesting professor.  Have taken both Greek and Roman Hist (HIST 3337) and Renaissance and Reformation (HIST 4444) with him.  Lectures are interesting, and tests are almost entirely over lecture material.
Dean of the history department. If you are a history major, make this guy your friend! Very nice, very helpful, great guy, and an awesome professor. Also heads the study abroad to Italy.

He makes the concepts in his class very clear by restating everything simply.  He uses the socratic method alot to get students involved in the learning process He is the best professor I have ever had.
I took numerous classes from Dr. Shealy when I was at KSU 10 years ago.  I absolutely love him.  He makes you work, but you learn and have fun while doing so.  He's the best professor I ever had.
